learning_outcomes.description: Identify prominent theories and models about human behaviour in organisations, and critically discuss their application to management.
Identify prominent theories and models of group functioning in organisations, and critically discuss their significance in workplaces.
As an individual and in groups, explain how organisations function as institutions including issues of structure, power, politics, and change.
Critically examine your own behaviour as a manager, and identify strategies for improving your skills in people management.
Reflect on the ethical and social impact of managing people within organisations.

assessments.due_date: 9/09/2024 - 13/09/2024This Group Presentation will be conducted in a workshop
assessments.task_description: This is agroup assignmentthat will be delivered during a workshop.It consists of a10 minute oral presentationusing no more than three (3) power point slides.The aim of this Group Presentation is to demonstrate your ability to work in a small team to apply key organisational behaviour theories to a real-world organisational problem/opportunity of the team's own choice.To complete this assignment:Review the key concepts/theories from the first five lectures: (1) individual behaviour, personality, and values, (2) emotions, attitudes, and stress, (3) motivation, (4) decision making and creativity, and (5) groups and teams.Discuss a current real-world organisational issue with your learning team (formed in week one) and prepare a 10 minute presentation covering the following:The organization and its problem/opportunity.A brief summary of the key issues using two or more concepts/theories from the first five lectures.Recommendations, based on your chosen concepts/theories, to address these key issues.Please select an organisation and problem/opportunity that has recently appeared in the media (i.e., within the last three-months).Further information for this assignment will be provided during the lecture immediately prior to the workshop.This is a group assignment and will be presented during the workshop. All learning team members must contribute toward the group presentation.Please Note:The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes.Criteria & MarkingSelf and Peer Review Process:Group members are expected to contribute equally, fulfilling the tasks agreed on early in the semester. If there are disagreements in relation to team members' contributions that cannot be resolved, students must bring the problem to the attention of the Course Coordinator/Tutor as early as possible.Students will be required to complete a Self and Peer Review Evaluation, reflecting on their own and their member's contributions during the development of the group assessment items. A student's final grade for this assessment item could be altered based on feedback from the Peer evaluations.Team members that work in good faith will not experience grade adjustments, while individuals that perform below expectations or fail to pull their weight will experience a negative grade adjustment. The Course Coordinator reserves the right to adjust peer evaluations to ensure fairness.Students are advised to be proactive and make expectations of one another clear from the start. Poor communication is often the source of discrepancies.It is expected that any problems that arise will be brought to the Course Coordinator's attention well before the assessment submission deadlines.This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.Read full task descriptionHide full task description

assessments.task_description: This is anindividual assignment.The word limit is 2,000 words, +/- 10% (excluding references, appendices, tables)The aim of this assignment is to critically analyse how organisational behaviour theory can explain organisational success or failure.To complete this assignment:Choose a real-world example of an organisation that in the last 2 to 5 years has experienced considerable success or failure. This could be measured, for example, in terms of financial performance, reputation, or corporate social responsibility (CSR).Describe the actions or inactions leading to success or failure using at least three organisational behaviour theories/concepts covered in the course.Critically evaluate the short and long-term consequences/impact of these actions or inactions.Make recommendations for what could have been done better.
